intro: Congdonia coerulea, commonly known as the blue star, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Congdonia coerulea is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 3 feet, with lance-shaped leaves that are often bluish-green in color.
